ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Further grammatical structure, improved my German speaking and listening, learned about German cities and improved reading through a novel we read across the semester.
I developed my speaking skills a lot. Grammar was heavily focused on so I felt like my grammar definitely improved a lot throughout the semester.

Taking German 140 significantly improved my German conversational, writing, and listening skills. I learned about the cultures of different German/German-speaking cities like Dsseldorf, Dresden, and Wien, and also practiced my writing skills with weekly journals and longer essays.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: our class was small and bonded pretty well which made the experience much more enjoyable, Aida is incredibly friendly & encouraging

Weaknesses: could sometimes be a lot of work and I was often forced to start problem sets for other classes the day they were due as I first had to complete work for German that was due every other day or so. Tests were a bit rough at first and multiple of us didn't finish, but they found a better balance as the semester progressed.

The strengths was the small class size which allowed me to get to know all my classmates pretty well. One weakness was the degree of difficulty for the tests. Some weeks the tests were much more difficult than others.

The course was organized very well and gave detailed outlines of every unit. Improvements would be more time spent on each topic learned since at times the content felt rushed due to how many vocabulary words and grammar structures we had to memorize

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you're at this level it's the right course to take. I already knew much of the grammar we learned going in, but it allowed me to work a lot on my speaking, listening, and reading which were all definitely lacking.

If you want to improve your German, especially your grammar, I would recommend this course. It really moves beyond L3 and focuses on complex sentence structures. However, the workload did increase from L3 because the asynchronous activities often took up a lot of time every week. There were still bi-weekly tests, but they got more difficult in comparison to L3 (which makes sense).
Yes! This is a great course for anyone looking to improve their German skills and learn more about German culture.
